title: EXECUTIVE PRODUCER, ANIMATION, GAMES & INNOVATION
description:
We are seeking a dynamic **Executive Producer** to lead the production of high-quality animated content for games and interactive experiences. This role requires a strategic thinker with deep industry knowledge, strong leadership skills, and a passion for pioneering new storytelling techniques. Our ideal candidate is someone with a love for games and a deep understanding of the games industry, including familiarity with game publishers, developers, and fan communities.

The right person for this role is excited by innovation challenges, not intimidated by them – working with the team to come up with new solutions and pushing the boundaries of our creative and technical offerings to our clients with a strong knowledge of the latest in emerging tech and AI capabilities. Whether working in a traditional pipeline, a game engine, or the latest in AI tools, the EP in this role will be able to comfortably navigate a wide range of creative and technical challenges in collaboration with our team.

The Executive Producer will oversee multiple projects, manage budgets and schedules, and work closely with creative and technical teams to deliver engaging and visually stunning content. Part of what makes EP-ing at Psyop exciting is that no two projects are the same, and there is endless opportunity to explore new creative and technical approaches.

The ideal candidate will be located within the Los Angeles or New York area but candidates located remotely throughout the United States with the desired experience will be considered as well.

#### **POSITION OVERVIEW**

* This role is open to both Freelance and Full-Time candidates.
* This role will lead and oversee the development and production of animation projects for games and interactive media, ensuring alignment with the company’s vision and goals.
* This role will be a creative partner for our directors, always able and ready to offer up suggestions and resources to support their vision.
* Role will require a combination of qualities; encompassing those of a Creative Strategist, Producer, Talent Manager and Sales Professional.
* This role will uphold a positive force within the studio, keeping spirits up and morale high while being a supporting and grounding presence with producers, crew and other team members.
* This role will be a trusted partner for clients, always ready to help figure out a project while being a strategic and entrepreneurial thinker, identifying and going after promising opportunities, while building and maintaining long term relationships.
* This role will drive the exploration and development of Emerging Technologies for use in Psyop projects.
* Using their contacts within the Games/Interactive/Immersive industry, this EP will develop an innovation strategy to identify opportunities in the emerging technology landscape.
* Ideal candidates will have an excellent understanding of Psyop’s strategic vision and how to achieve that vision while at the same time finding opportunities to increase sales.

#### **RESPONSIBILITES**

*Will include but are not limited to;*

* Lead and oversee the development and production of animation projects for games and interactive media, ensuring alignment with the company’s vision and goals.
* Develop, cultivate and maintain relationships with current and new clients and external partners.
* Identify and secure new business opportunities, helping to expand the company’s reach in the gaming and interactive entertainment sectors. Key decision maker in project selection.
* Establish pitch strategy and manage pitches by clearly defining what needs to be done to succeed creatively and financially, making sure to collaborate effectively with directors.
* Collaborate with creative directors, game designers, animators, writers, and technical teams to shape compelling narratives and innovative experiences.
* Oversee bidding and the development of a potential production plan. Work with HoPs to determine resource allocation strategies.
* Manage project timelines, budgets, and resources, ensuring on-time and on-budget delivery of high-quality content from beginning to end.
* Mentor producers throughout the course of production, helping to guide margins, creative trouble shooting and client communications.
* Drive innovation in animation pipelines, production workflows, and emerging technologies to enhance production efficiency and creativity.
* Foster a culture of creativity, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the production team.
* Be a thought leader on creative production internally and externally, advocating for our craft.
* Must exhibit hands-on technology leadership in development of projects, including but not limited to ideation and selection of which technologies are appropriate for each opportunity.

#### **EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS**

* 5+ years of experience as a Senior Producer and/or 3+ years as an Executive Producer (or an equivalent leadership role) in the animation and/or games industry.
* Passion for storytelling, innovation, and pushing the boundaries of what animation can achieve in gaming and interactive experiences.
* Must have a good range of production experience dealing with various creative approaches at varying budget levels.
* Must have a strong understanding of the 2D & 3D pipeline and process. As well as knowledge and passion for emerging technologies such as AI, gaming engines, and procedural content generation.
* Excellent communication and project management skills.
* Able to anticipate production challenges and problem solve.
* Strong leadership and team management skills.
* Must be able to present creative opinions in a clear and concise manner.
* Must be able to juggle multiple projects and tasks at one time while staying organized.
* Must be able to work well within a team environment and have strong interpersonal skills.
* Knowledge of CETA iCFM software is a plus.

*Psyop is committed to building and maintaining an inclusive workplace. We offer flexible working practices and welcome and encourage applications from candidates who are under-represented in the creative industries.*

*Psyop provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*

*In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.*

*The approximate salary range for this role will be between $150k – $180k annually depending on experience.*

title: User Experience Writer
description:
**Title:**
UX Writer

**Location:**
New York, NY (remote)

**Type:**
Contract

Our client is seeking a UX Writer to write and edit digital-first content for a variety of audiences including patients, caregivers, and the general public.

* **Key Accountabilities:**
* Craft high-intent content, including headlines, display copy, and CTAs, that drive action, engagement, and conversions.
* Lead writing on A/B copy testing.
* Work on projects involving content creation in new design templates.
* Use data and analysis to inform copy.

* **Required Skills**
* Bachelor's degree in: Communications, Marketing, Journalism, or English.
* Five (5) to seven (7) years of experience in content creation, with an emphasis in the digital space.
* Experience with UX writing, content testing, and data measurement and analysis.
* Strong understanding of SEO and how it informs content creation and information architecture.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Knowledge of visual design principles and an understanding of how content can address and resolve design challenges.
* A collaborative spirit, solution-oriented mindset, and the ability to communicate with multiple stakeholders.
* The ability to multi-task, manage priorities, and deliver work on deadline.
* Familiarity with Microsoft Office suite / SharePoint, Drupal, Figma, and Airtable are all ideal.
* Experience in healthcare is a plus.
company_industry: Information Technology & Services and Hospitals and Health Care

description:

- if selected, please know that for next steps, we will ask you to send writing samples and potentially a quick video introducing yourself and your work.

We provide a seamless way for fitness professionals to monetize their content and connect with a broader audience. Join us and start your creation journey today: www.joinplaybook.com

title: Movies & TV List Journalist
description:
**This is a paid freelance, remote position.**
If you’re an experienced writer with a finger on the pulse of the Film & Television world, CBR wants you to join its award-winning writing team! CBR is the oldest and most respected comic book culture website in the world. It is the internet’s first and final stop for nerd culture, news, commentary and community.
  
  
Our editorial team is looking for writers to create original and informative Movie & Television List articles that our discerning audience demands, with the eye-catching aesthetic they crave. CBR operates at a rapid pace and is seeking writers who can produce high-quality articles under time constraints. The selected candidate will have tremendous career growth and internal development opportunities within the organization.
  
  
Please visitwww.cbr.comand review your familiarity with our range of topics before applying. In your cover letter, make sure to tell us how your knowledge of the specific vertical you’re applying for will complement CBR’s coverage.
  
  
**What we are looking for:**

* A passion for the content and a drive to grow within the industry
* Previous writing experience (Editing experience is a plus)
* Broad working knowledge of the Film & Television world (including Game of Thrones/House of the Dragon, MCU, sitcoms, Sci-fi, Star Wars and the Walking Dead)
* The ability to analyze content and pull directly from the source material to back up claims
* A sharp eye for grammatical details
* Excellent command of the English language
* Ability to write high-quality articles with swift turn-around times
* Comfortable working in an entirely virtual environment

+ Should possess a general understanding of the culture and strong research skill

**Responsibilities:**

* Write articlesin CBR’s house style (following the requisite training)

+ This will include fact-checking, formatting, linking, and image sourcing/very basic editing (sizing, brightness, etc.)

* Brainstorm, pitch, and develop original content ideas
* Accept and apply any/all feedback received by the editorial team
* Communicate openly and actively with the editorial team

**What CBR has to offer:**

* Fully remote — write from anywhere in North America or the UK
* Opportunities to pitch original ideas
* Several helpful guides that you can refer to even after training
* Incredible opportunities for career growth within a supportive system
* An amazing community of like-minded people to nerd-out with on a daily basis

NOTE: Only applications containing a resume
**and**
cover letter will be considered.
**It is essential that you demonstrate your breadth of knowledge of Movie/TV content in your cover letter. You will not be considered for the role if this information is not included**
. Please note that the next step in the hiring process involves a writing evaluation.
  
  
We look forward to hearing from you!
  
  
Powered by JazzHR

title: TheSportster - Wrestling Journalist
Marketing Associates - Freelance
description:
Our client, a global animal health company, is seeking two Marketing Associates to join their rewards marketing team.
  
  
Retail Account Support
  
  

* Assist in managing day-to-day retail marketing activities across key customer accounts
* Audit product detail pages (PDPs) across retail sites to identify gaps or outdated content
* Coordinate the handoff and upload of updated copy, images, and assets to maintain accurate PDPs
* Monitor live marketing campaigns; capture and organize screenshots and performance context
* Track competitor marketing activity across key retail partners both manually and using a digital shelf analytics (DSA) tooland summarize key findings to support internal reporting and strategy
* Support retailer meeting prep by drafting agendas, attending meetings, taking notes, and managing follow-up tasks
* Assist in reporting activities, including updating presentation decks, pulling campaign metrics, and summarizing performance insights

Digital Asset Management
  
  

* Help organize and upload product assets into Salsify and internal shared drives
* Maintain and update metadata, images, and product information to ensure a complete and accurate digital asset library
* Assist in content QA to ensure files meet brand and retailer-specific guidelines

Project & Calendar Coordination
  
  

* Maintain and update project timelines and campaign calendars in Asana
* Ensure marketing tasks are logged, assigned, and progressing on schedule

**Ideal Qualifications**

* 2-3 years of experience in marketing, account management, or content coordination (CPG, e-commerce, or retail experience preferred)
* Strong organizational skills with excellent attention to detail
* Familiarity with digital asset management platforms (experience with Salsify is a plus)
* Comfortable using project management tools such as Asana
* Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint; ability to analyze data and create clear visuals
* Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Self-starter with a proactive mindset and willingness to learn

In this position, you may have access to client or customer systems, confidential and/or proprietary information or data, including medical data.
  
  
**Benefits**
Creative Circle's Freelance Employee benefits package includes eligibility for Minimum Essential Coverage (MEC) medical plan, dental/vision/term life package, discount prescription program, critical illness, accident, tele-behavioral health, and 401(k) plan. Sick leave is provided to Candidates whose assignment work location is in a state or city subject to sick leave laws. A Minimum Value (MV) PPO medical plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, and paid holiday eligibility are based on length and dates of service.
  
  
**Email Your Resume In Word To**
Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. Clicking apply is the best way to apply, but you may also:
  
  
jennifer.marshall@jobalert.creativecircle.com
  
  

* Please do NOT change the email subject line in any way. You must keep the JobID: linkedin : JM18-1853406 -- in the email subject line for your application to be considered.\\*\\*\\*

Jennifer Marshall - Lead Recruiter
  
  
For Creative Circle to represent you for this opportunity, you must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need of employer sponsorship for a non-immigrant visa such as a H-1B, TN, or O visa. We do not support or provide training for STEM/OPT programs. Additionally, you must be physically located in and perform the work for our client in the United States.
  
  
This job was first posted by Creative Circle on 05/16/2025 and applications will be accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled or closed.
  
  
**Creative Circle is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Creative Circle will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local law, including but not limited to the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, and the California Fair Chance Act. If you need a reasonable accommodation in the application process, please contact your Recruiter (the person you'll be interviewing with) or a member of our Human Resources team to make arrangements. title: ServiceNow Business Analyst (Integrations)
description:
STAND 8 provides end to end IT solutions to enterprise partners across the United States and with offices in Los Angeles, New York, New Jersey, Atlanta, and more including internationally in Mexico and India.

Are you an expert
**ServiceNow Business Systems Analyst**
and want to truly make a positive impact? Come and join us in building an awesome brand-new ServiceNow instance within our global Media & Entertainment client! The ServiceNow Business System Analyst will collect, clarify, analyze, and translate business requirements into documentation and conceptual designs for ServiceNow solutions. The analyst identifies areas to reduce implementation efforts, defines detailed stories with acceptance criteria, and works within the Agile or Scrum development framework.
  
  
We are setting up interviews now and if you'd enjoy contributing to building a world-class brand-new global SNOW instance then we'd love to hear from you!
  
  
**Responsibilities**

* Customer Engagement: Participate as a domain expert in customer-facing meetings to discuss Service Management processes and features.
* Documentation: Document workflows, processes, and results of business analysis.
* Requirements Analysis: Develop a thorough understanding of customer requirements and assist the project team in applying industry best practices and detailed knowledge of ServiceNow to design optimal solutions.
* Application Design: Assist the project team in translating application functionality into application architecture and produce business functionality requirements.
* Wireframes/Mockups: Create wireframes/mockups for user stories, review them with customers, and gather feedback.
* Risk Management: Identify and document risks and constraints related to requirements.
* User Stories: Break down documented requirements into epics and decompose them into user stories and acceptance criteria.
* Testing: Assist and lead test plan development and execution, perform functional tests on each configured story.
* Quality Management: Assist in quality management reviews to ensure all business and design requirements are met.
* Change Management: Support Organizational Change Management (OCM) efforts by providing information on the "to be" solution.
* Training: Assist, develop, and deliver end-user training.
* Automated Testing: Assist in the development of automated tests in ServiceNow.

**Qualifications**

* 4+ years of experience with IT Service Management solutions in an enterprise environment, preferably ServiceNow.
* 3 years of experience in business processes and business analysis in a software application environment.
* 3 years of experience designing and developing process workflows, capturing and writing requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
* 3 years of experience developing and maintaining system lifecycle documentation.
* Understanding of both functional and non-functional software testing.
* Strong understanding of the ServiceNow Application Suite covering ITSM, ITOM, and ITBM areas.
* Superior attention to detail with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to understand complex business needs and adapt appropriately.
* Ability to learn and adapt to new solutions applicable to the ServiceNow platform.
* Excellent knowledge of best practices and understanding of industry trends.

**Desired**

* ITIL v3 or ITIL 4 Certification or equivalent practical experience.
* Comfortable leading in both technical and organizational contexts.
* Experience working on projects with large global/multinational corporations.

**Additional Details**
The base range for this contract position is $60-70/per hour, depending on experience.
  
  
Our pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hires of this position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered.
  
  
**Benefits**

* Medical coverage and Health Savings Account (HSA) through Anthem
* Dental/Vision/Various Ancillary coverages through Unum
* 401(k) retirement savings plan
* Company-paid Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Discount programs through ADP WorkforceNow

**About Us**
STAND 8 provides end-to-end IT solutions to enterprise partners across the United States and globally with offices in Los Angeles, Atlanta, New York, Mexico, Japan, India, and more. STAND 8 focuses on the "bleeding edge" of technology and leverages automation, process, marketing, and over fifteen years of success and growth to provide a world-class experience for our customers, partners, and employees.
  
  
Our mission is to impact the world positively by creating success through PEOPLE, PROCESS, and TECHNOLOGY.
  
  
Check out more at www.stand8.io; and reach out today to explore opportunities to grow together!

By applying to this position, your data will be processed in accordance with the STAND 8 Privacy Policy.
